title: About Hack4Change
opening: Hack4Change is Moncton's inaugural civic tech hackathon, organized by Civic Tech Moncton in partnership with the Greater Moncton Homelessness Steering Committee. This three-day intensive event brings together developers, designers, students, and community advocates to build technology solutions that create lasting community impact.

whatMakesDifferent.title: What Makes This Different
whatMakesDifferent.subtitle: Most hackathons end with abandoned prototypes. Not this one.
whatMakesDifferent.description: The winning solution will be fully developed and deployed through a committed partnership between Civic Tech Moncton volunteers, the winning team, and the Greater Moncton Homelessness Steering Committee (GMHSC).
benefits: Be developed into a production-ready application
Be deployed to GMHSC member organizations across Southeast New Brunswick
Make measurable, lasting impact on community service delivery
whatMakesDifferent.closing: This isn't just a competition. It's the beginning of a real project.

challenge.title: The Challenge
challenge.partner: Partner: Greater Moncton Homelessness Steering Committee (GMHSC)
challenge.description: GMHSC coordinates multiple service locations across Southeast New Brunswick serving individuals experiencing homelessness. Currently, these organizations lack efficient tools for real-time resource sharing and coordination across locations.
challenge.mission: Your Mission: Design and prototype innovative technology solutions that enable community organizations to:
objectives: Respond more effectively to community needs
challenge.reveal: The Reveal: Specific challenge requirements, technical constraints, and success criteria will be revealed Friday, March 13th at 6 PM. This ensures all teams start with equal information and preparation time.
challenge.transparency: Transparency Note: While participants receive the detailed challenge Friday evening, we share more context with sponsors to help them understand the community impact of their investment. Sponsors know WHY this matters; participants discover HOW to solve it.

whyMatters.title: Why This Matters
whyMatters.description:
Greater Moncton faces a visible homelessness crisis disproportionately severe compared to major Canadian cities. As of August 2024, 511 individuals are experiencing chronic homelessness in our community.

GMHSC works tirelessly to coordinate services, but lacks the technology infrastructure to maximize their impact. Every improvement in coordination means faster, more effective support for vulnerable community members.

Your solution will have measurable impact on real lives.

whoShould.title: Who Should Participate
whoShould.intro: You're a great fit if you are:
profiles: Anyone passionate about using technology to solve social challenges
whoShould.note: No experience with homelessness services required! GMHSC representatives and mentors will provide domain expertise.

prizes.title: Prizes & Recognition
prizes.prizePool: A prize pool of at least $5,000 will be awarded to winning teams, with exact amounts to be announced as sponsorship is finalized.
prizes.beyond: Beyond cash prizes, winning teams receive:
benefits: Partnership with Civic Tech Moncton to develop the full solution
Recognition as the solution is deployed to community organizations
Ongoing attribution in all communications about the deployed solution
prizes.note: Prize categories and judging criteria will be announced with the challenge reveal on Friday evening.

gmhsc.title: Challenge Partner: Greater Moncton Homelessness Steering Committee
gmhsc.description:
The Greater Moncton Homelessness Steering Committee (GMHSC) is a multi-stakeholder network of professionals from community organizations and all levels of government, working collaboratively to prevent and reduce homelessness by increasing access to safe, adequate, and supportive housing.

Using a data-informed systems approach, GMHSC drives lasting change through education, advocacy, and targeted support, ensuring affordable housing and essential services are available to those in need.

civicTech.title: About Civic Tech Moncton
civicTech.description: Launched in September 2024, Civic Tech Moncton is a volunteer-driven initiative that harnesses technology and collaboration to solve real-world challenges in Greater Moncton. We meet weekly at Venn Innovation, bringing together developers, designers, students, professionals, and community advocates.
civicTech.mission: Our Mission: To empower community members to use technology as a force for positive change, making Greater Moncton a more connected, innovative, and inclusive place to live.
civicTech.milestone: This hackathon represents our first major public event and a milestone in establishing Moncton as a hub for civic technology in Atlantic Canada.
